evidence_items.text: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle. The airfield boundary fence in the Rwy 07 undershoot had also sustained damage. The barbed wire support arm on one fence pole was missing and the wire had been severed in that location.

Safety reporting With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024. In the MOR, the event type was recorded as ‘ Incident.’ Following a review of the report, ASSI reclassified the event as a Serious Incident and notified the AAIB on 6 January 2025.

Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’ Although they were requested from the commander, further details of the occurrence, which could have provided greater insight into the content and context of their 8 November statement, were not provided to the AAIB.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present during the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD incident on 10-25 in the early historical timeframe.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: There is no evidence contradicting the presence of communication/coordination breakdown among crew in the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD incident on 10-25 in the early historical timeframe.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features observed in the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD incident on 10-25, such as timing, crew roles, and situational context.

node.statement: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present during the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD incident on 10-25 in the early historical timeframe.

defeaters: Evidence showing explicit communication or coordination problems among the crew during the incident would change the assessment.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items indicates any communication or coordination breakdown among the crew during the incident; all statements focus on the aircraft's undershoot and damage without mention of crew communication issues (H1-H4, S1-S3).

slot_statements.availability: Availability of data and evidence regarding environmental or marking deficiencies in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early.

defeaters: If no formal records or reports existed documenting the environmental or marking deficiencies
If the damage was caused by non-aircraft sources and not documented

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.

Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.
With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence (H1, S2) confirms the presence and damage of a frangible light and tyre marks indicating aircraft contact with the runway undershoot area; H2 confirms formal reporting of the damage, establishing availability of data and evidence.
outcome.uncertainty_source: None significant; evidence is clear and consistent

slot_statements.defeater_resistance: Mechanical/control failure is resistant to defeaters within the context of Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: Mechanical/control failure matches the key features observed in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early.

defeaters: Evidence of mechanical or control system anomalies or failures during the event
Pilot or maintenance reports indicating mechanical/control failure
Data from aircraft systems showing malfunction
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates any mechanical or control failure occurred; all evidence describes an undershoot and damage to airfield infrastructure without mention of mechanical/control issues (H1, H3, H4, S1, S2, S3).
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct or indirect evidence about mechanical/control failure is present; only airfield damage and pilot statements about weather and landing are available.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early dataset.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identification of procedural deviation in pushback execution within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early scope is robust and resistant to common defeaters or contradictory evidence.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with the key features observed in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early scope, reflecting relevant operational characteristics.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early dataset.

defeaters: If the dataset contained explicit documentation or records of the procedural deviation in pushback execution.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided dataset explicitly documents or makes available the procedural deviation in pushback execution.

node.statement: Assessment of how well the environmental or marking deficiency fits the key features observed in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early.

defeaters: If evidence showed the tyre marks were from a ground vehicle or the light was missing prior to the incident
If the aircraft did not actually undershoot or strike the light

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to  arrest the descent, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence directly supports that the aircraft undershot the runway, struck and damaged a frangible light consistent with the environmental conditions and observed tyre marks (H1, S1, S2, H4).
outcome.uncertainty_source: Limited detail on exact environmental conditions and absence of further crew statements limit full certainty.

node.statement: Evaluation of the resistance of the environmental or marking deficiency explanation to defeaters in the context of Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early.

defeaters: If evidence showed the light was intact before the event or damage was caused by a ground vehicle, or if pilot reports indicated deliberate deviation from procedures unrelated to environment or markings.

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.

On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to  arrest the descent , the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence (H1, S2) confirms damage to runway lighting consistent with an aircraft undershoot, while pilot statements (H4, S3) and weather conditions (S1) support the environmental factors explanation. The pilot's unawareness of striking the light and lack of occurrence report (H4, S3) do not contradict the environmental/marking deficiency explanation, indicating resistance to defeaters.
outcome.uncertainty_source: Lack of detailed pilot report and absence of further investigation details limit full understanding of event context.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs, communication device logs, and physical presence records to confirm availability

children_spec.statement: Communication devices were operational and accessible to all crew members
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and device functionality tests to verify communication equipment availability

children_spec.statement: Crew members were not engaged in conflicting tasks that prevented communication
children_spec.test_procedure: Review task assignments and timing to determine if any duties interfered with communication availability

node.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation

defeaters: Direct statements or logs confirming crew physical presence and communication availability during the operation
Evidence of crew being unreachable or absent during the operation

quotes.exact_quote: Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence indicates the flight crew was unaware of striking obstacles and did not report the incident, implying they were present but possibly not fully aware or reachable for communication about the damage (H3, H4, S3). No direct evidence confirms physical presence and reachability during the operation.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in crew awareness and communication status; no direct evidence of physical presence or reachability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control were physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and physical condition reports to verify presence and integrity of mechanical control components

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were free from obstruction or blockage
children_spec.test_procedure: Conduct physical inspection and functional tests to detect any obstructions or blockages in mechanical control pathways

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were properly connected and linked to control inputs
children_spec.test_procedure: Review assembly and maintenance documentation and perform mechanical linkage tests to confirm proper connections

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were not degraded or worn beyond operational limits
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine wear and tear reports, conduct material inspections and functional tests to assess component condition

node.statement: Mechanical control components were not degraded or worn beyond operational limits

defeaters: Evidence showing mechanical control components were degraded or worn beyond operational limits
Maintenance records or inspection reports indicating mechanical control condition
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items addresses the condition of mechanical control components or their degradation/wear status.

children_spec.statement: Pushback crew was present and available at the scheduled time
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs and timestamps to confirm presence at scheduled pushback time

children_spec.statement: Pushback equipment was operational and ready for use
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance records and equipment status reports prior to pushback

children_spec.statement: Communication systems between cockpit and pushback crew were functional
children_spec.test_procedure: Test communication logs and equipment functionality tests before pushback

node.statement: Pushback equipment was operational and ready for use

defeaters: Evidence showing pushback equipment was not operational or unavailable
Direct statements confirming pushback equipment status
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items mentions the operational status or readiness of pushback equipment.

node.statement: Mechanical components required for control were physically present and intact

assumptions: No mechanical control failure was reported or observed
Damage to external runway lights does not imply missing or damaged mechanical control components on the aircraft
defeaters: If evidence showed mechanical components were missing or damaged on the aircraft
If the crew reported mechanical control issues
If inspection of the aircraft revealed missing or damaged mechanical control components

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.

On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].

N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence shows the aircraft undershot the runway and damaged a frangible light (H1, S2), but the commander was unaware of striking anything and did not report mechanical issues (H4, S3). There is no direct evidence that mechanical control components were missing or damaged; the damage was to external runway infrastructure.
outcome.uncertainty_source: lack of direct inspection or report on mechanical control components' physical presence and condition

children_spec.statement: The environmental conditions at the time match the known key features of environmental deficiencies
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare recorded environmental data (weather, visibility, lighting) with established criteria for environmental deficiencies

children_spec.statement: The aircraft or operation area shows evidence of marking deficiencies consistent with the key features
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect physical markings and signage for compliance with standards and note any deviations matching deficiency patterns

children_spec.statement: The observed deficiencies align with documented cases of environmental or marking deficiencies in similar contexts
children_spec.test_procedure: Review historical incident reports and compare the current case's features with documented deficiency cases

node.statement: The aircraft or operation area shows evidence of marking deficiencies consistent with the key features

assumptions: The missing frangible light constitutes a marking deficiency consistent with key features
defeaters: If the missing light was due to other causes unrelated to the aircraft or operation area
If the tyre marks and fence damage were caused by non-aircraft sources

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence (H1, S2) shows a frangible light was missing/damaged consistent with the aircraft undershooting the runway, indicating marking deficiencies consistent with key features.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit confirmation that the missing light was a marking deficiency prior to the event; limited detail on other markings

node.statement: The observed deficiencies align with documented cases of environmental or marking deficiencies in similar contexts

assumptions: The missing frangible light and tyre marks indicate a deficiency in runway environment or markings that contributed to the undershoot.
defeaters: If evidence showed the damage was caused by factors unrelated to environmental or marking deficiencies, or if the runway markings and environment were confirmed fully compliant and adequate.

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The direct evidence (H1, S2) shows that the aircraft undershot the runway and damaged a frangible light, consistent with environmental or marking deficiencies contributing to the event.
outcome.uncertainty_source: lack of detailed information on the exact environmental or marking deficiencies and their documented similarity to other cases
